analyzed: bde par gnas pa bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par zhugs so //

original: bde ba'ang med pa /

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa las bzhengs nas bsam gtan dang po la zhugs so //

translated: As soon as the Blessed One entered the meditative absorption called “the display of the body’s form according to the disciples,” the Blessed One immediately sat resplendent, radiant, and shining.

original: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa tshangs pa'i gnas na 'dug bzhin du bcom ldan 'das shin tu lham me lhan ne lhang nge ba dang / skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa mthong ngo //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa dag gis bzhengs par gsol to //

original: zil pa'i thig pa dang 'dra ba /🔽g-yo ba / mi gnas pa /
analyzed: zil pa'i thig pa dang 'dra ba / g-yo ba / mi gnas pa /
translated: It is like a drop of dew.🔽It is unstable.

original: mi gtsang ba /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba /
translated: It is impure.

original: rnag gi dri ma can /
analyzed: rnag gi dri ma can /
translated: It is filthy with pus.

original: rlung dang / nyi mas mthar thug @5b ba; mthar 'drul ba /
analyzed: rlung dang / nyi mas mthar thug @5b ba; mthar 'drul ba /
translated: It is destroyed by wind and sun.

original: mthar rdul du 'gyur ba /🔽ngan skyugs kyi mthar thug pa /
analyzed: mthar rdul du 'gyur ba / ngan skyugs kyi mthar thug pa /
translated: It ends up as dust.🔽It ends up as vomit.

original: nad mang ba /
analyzed: nad mang ba /
translated: It is full of disease.

original: gnod pa can /
analyzed: gnod pa can /
translated: It is harmful.

original: 'go ba'i nad mang ba /
analyzed: 'go ba'i nad mang ba /
translated: It is full of contagious diseases.

original: na ba / 'jig pa'i ngang can /
analyzed: na ba / 'jig pa'i ngang can /
translated: It is sick. It is subject to destruction.

original: rus pa bsogs pa /
analyzed: rus pa bsogs pa /
translated: It is a collection of bones.

original: dri nga ba /
analyzed: dri nga ba /
translated: It is foul-smelling.🔽It is dripping. It needs to be carefully tended.

original: 'dzag pa can bsgrims te rim gro byed dgos pa yin par yang dag pa'i dran pas yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog go /
analyzed: 'dzag pa can bsgrims te rim gro byed dgos pa yin par yang dag pa'i dran pas yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog go /
translated: He correctly and accurately observes it with correct mindfulness.

original: de de ltar yang dag pa'i dran pas lus kyi skyon rnams yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas lus la chags pa dang / lus la kun tu 'dod chags dang / lus la bdag gi nyid yin pa mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de de ltar yang dag pa'i dran pas lus kyi skyon rnams yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas lus la chags pa dang / lus la kun tu 'dod chags dang / lus la bdag gi nyid yin pa mi bskyed do //
translated: In this way, through right mindfulness, they correctly and as they are understand the faults of the body. They do not generate attachment to the body, desire for the body, or the notion that the body is theirs.

original: de lus la mi lta bas srog chags pa dang / srog la kun tu 'dod chags dang / srog la bdag gi nyid yin pa mi bskyed do //
analyzed: de lus la mi lta bas srog chags pa dang / srog la kun tu 'dod chags dang / srog la bdag gi nyid yin pa mi bskyed do //
translated: Since they do not look at the body, they do not generate attachment to life, desire for life, or the notion that life is theirs.

original: de lus dang srog la mi lta bar chos gos ngan ngon dang / kha zas ngan ngon dang / mal cha dang / stan ngan ngon dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ngan ngon tsam dag gis chog par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de lus dang srog la mi lta bar chos gos ngan ngon dang / kha zas ngan ngon dang / mal cha dang / stan ngan ngon dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad ngan ngon tsam dag gis chog par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Since they do not look at the body or life, they are content with just the bare necessities of Dharma robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for curing the sick.

original: de tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi bya ba gang dag yin pa don dang ldan pa rnams sam /
analyzed: de tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi bya ba gang dag yin pa don dang ldan pa rnams sam /
translated: They are not lazy about the duties of the community, whether they are meaningful or not,

original: dge ba dang ldan pa rnams kyang de dag la stong bar byed de /
analyzed: dge ba dang ldan pa rnams kyang de dag la stong bar byed de /
translated: and they are not lazy about the virtuous activities of the community.

original: yongs su mi skyo zhing yongs su yid 'chad pa med la yongs su skyo ba'i sems mi bskyed do //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyo zhing yongs su yid 'chad pa med la yongs su skyo ba'i sems mi bskyed do //
translated: He does not become discouraged, does not become disheartened, and does not develop a defeatist attitude.

original: de mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi gan du 'gro na dran pa dang ldan zhing 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de mkhan po dang slob dpon gyi gan du 'gro na dran pa dang ldan zhing 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “When he goes to his preceptor or teacher, he is mindful and thinks,

original: mkhan po dag ni bsnyen par dka' ba /🔽slob dpon dag ni bsnyen @6a *//
analyzed: mkhan po dag ni bsnyen par dka' ba / slob dpon dag ni bsnyen @6a *//
translated: ‘Preceptors are difficult to serve.

original: par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: par dka' ba ste /
translated: Teachers are difficult to serve.🔽If I go there and someone accuses me of engaging in evil deeds, that would not be right.’

original: bdag der song ba na sdig pa mi dge ba kun tu spyod pa 'ga' zhig gis bdag la glengs shing dran par byas na mi rung ngo snyam nas de rgyu dang / rkyen de dang / gzhi des bslab pa rnams la gus pa byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag der song ba na sdig pa mi dge ba kun tu spyod pa 'ga' zhig gis bdag la glengs shing dran par byas na mi rung ngo snyam nas de rgyu dang / rkyen de dang / gzhi des bslab pa rnams la gus pa byed par 'gyur te /
translated: For that reason, he becomes respectful toward the trainings,

original: brtun par byed pa dang / legs par bya ba byed pa dang / zhi ba rnal du byed pa dang / shin tu yongs su mthar thug par byed pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtun par byed pa dang / legs par bya ba byed pa dang / zhi ba rnal du byed pa dang / shin tu yongs su mthar thug par byed pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: he becomes diligent, he becomes one who does good deeds, he becomes one who is peaceful and calm, and he becomes one who is very thorough.

original: de la bslab pa rnams la gus pa byed pa nyid dang / brtun par byed pa nyid dang / legs par bya ba byed pa nyid dang / zhi ba rnal du byed pa nyid dang / shin tu yongs su mthar thug par byed pa nyid kyis mkhan po dang /
analyzed: de la bslab pa rnams la gus pa byed pa nyid dang / brtun par byed pa nyid dang / legs par bya ba byed pa nyid dang / zhi ba rnal du byed pa nyid dang / shin tu yongs su mthar thug par byed pa nyid kyis mkhan po dang /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva who is devoted to the teacher and preceptor is one who is respectful toward the trainings, one who is diligent, one who does what is to be done well, one who is calm and peaceful, and one who is very thorough.

original: slob dpon gyi gan du 'gro ba na bag tsha ba med pa dang / bag 'khum pa med par 'gro zhing 'jigs pa dang / lhan cig tu byung ba'i rgol pa'ang mi ston ste /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi gan du 'gro ba na bag tsha ba med pa dang / bag 'khum pa med par 'gro zhing 'jigs pa dang / lhan cig tu byung ba'i rgol pa'ang mi ston ste /
translated: When he approaches the teacher and preceptor, he does so without timidity and without embarrassment, and he does not display any fear or resistance.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gus pa dang bcas shing zhes dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gus pa dang bcas shing zhes dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Why is this?🔽Because he is respectful and full of faith.

original: rigs kyi bag ma bzhin du 'dzem pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bag ma bzhin du 'dzem pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is also modest, like a girl of good family.

original: de la 'dzem pa dang ldan pas lus kyi skyon dang / lus kyi nyes par spyod pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyis thams cad du yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: de la 'dzem pa dang ldan pas lus kyi skyon dang / lus kyi nyes par spyod pa gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyis thams cad du yongs su spong ngo //
translated: Because of his modesty, he completely avoids all physical faults and all physical misdeeds.

original: tshangs pa / byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi skyon dang / lus kyi nyes par spyod pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs pa / byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi skyon dang / lus kyi nyes par spyod pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: Brahma, what are the faults of the body and the misdeeds of the body of the bodhisattvas?

original: tshangs pa / srog gcod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi skyon dang / lus kyi nyes par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa / srog gcod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi skyon dang / lus kyi nyes par spyod pa yin no //
translated: Brahma, killing is a fault of the body and a misdeed of the body of the bodhisattvas.

original: tshangs pa / @6b ma byin pa len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi skyon dang / lus kyi nyes par spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa / @6b ma byin pa len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi skyon dang / lus kyi nyes par spyod pa yin no //
translated: Brahma, taking what is not given and sexual misconduct are faults of the body and misdeeds of the body of the bodhisattvas.

original: tshangs pa / byang chub sems dpa' ci ltar na srog gcod pa spong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs pa / byang chub sems dpa' ci ltar na srog gcod pa spong ba yin zhe na /
translated: Brahma, how is it that the bodhisattvas abandon killing?

original: tshangs pa / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags kyi dbang gis srog chags kyi srog gcod par mi byed /
analyzed: tshangs pa / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags kyi dbang gis srog chags kyi srog gcod par mi byed /
translated: Brahma, here the bodhisattvas do not kill living beings out of desire,

original: zhe sdang gi dbang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis srog chags kyi srog gcod par mi byed do //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi dbang dang / gti mug gi dbang gis srog chags kyi srog gcod par mi byed do //
translated: nor do they kill living beings out of hatred, nor out of delusion.

original: de sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams la bdag tsam du 'du shes par byed cing sdug pa tsam du 'du shes par byed de /
analyzed: de sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams la bdag tsam du 'du shes par byed cing sdug pa tsam du 'du shes par byed de /
translated: He perceives other sentient beings and other persons as just the same as himself, as just the same as a loved one.

original: bdag nyid kyi sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi srog gcod par mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sems can gzhan dag dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi srog gcod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not kill himself, other sentient beings, or other persons.

original: gzhan dag kyang srog gcod du mi 'jug go /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang srog gcod du mi 'jug go /
translated: He does not induce others to kill.

original: gzhan dag srog gcod pa la yang dag par rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag srog gcod pa la yang dag par rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not rejoice when others kill.

original: bdag gis kyang mi gcod do //🔽gzhan dag kyang gcod mi 'jug go /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang mi gcod do // gzhan dag kyang gcod mi 'jug go /
translated: He does not kill himself.🔽He does not induce others to kill.

original: gzhan dag gcod pa la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gcod pa la'ang rjes su yi rang bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not rejoice when others kill.

original: bdag kyang mi rdeg go /🔽gzhan dag kyang rdeg du mi 'jug go /
analyzed: bdag kyang mi rdeg go / gzhan dag kyang rdeg du mi 'jug go /
translated: He does not beat himself.🔽He does not induce others to beat.

original: gzhan dag rdeg par byed pa la'ang rjes su yid rang bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag rdeg par byed pa la'ang rjes su yid rang bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not rejoice when others beat.

original: ji ltar na ma byin pa len pa spong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma byin pa len pa spong ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does he abandon taking what is not given?

original: tshangs pa; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang dag yin pa /
translated: “Brahmā, here bodhisattvas do not develop attachment to the necessities of life of sentient beings,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

original: gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man @7a *//
analyzed: gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man @7a *//
translated: gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells,

original: shel dang / byu ru dang / sa le sbram dang / dngul la sogs pa dang / gos dang / rgyan gyi rnam pa dag dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bde ba'i rnam pa de dag la chags pa mi skyed /
analyzed: shel dang / byu ru dang / sa le sbram dang / dngul la sogs pa dang / gos dang / rgyan gyi rnam pa dag dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bde ba'i rnam pa de dag la chags pa mi skyed /
translated: crystal, coral, refined gold, silver, and so on, clothes, ornaments, wealth, grain, treasuries, and the like.

original: de dag la rnam par rtog par mi byed cing rku 'phrog mi byed do //🔽rku 'phrog byed du mi 'jug go /
analyzed: de dag la rnam par rtog par mi byed cing rku 'phrog mi byed do // rku 'phrog byed du mi 'jug go /
translated: They do not conceptualize them and do not steal them.🔽They do not cause others to steal them.

original: rku 'phrog byed pa rnams la rjes su yi rang par mi byed do //🔽de grong na yod pa'am /
analyzed: rku 'phrog byed pa rnams la rjes su yi rang par mi byed do // de grong na yod pa'am /
translated: They do not rejoice in those who steal.

original: dgon pa na yod pa ma byin zhing ma gnang ba rtsva'i 'dab ma tsam yang len par mi byed do //
analyzed: dgon pa na yod pa ma byin zhing ma gnang ba rtsva'i 'dab ma tsam yang len par mi byed do //
translated: Whether in a town or in the wilderness, they do not take anything that is not given, not even a blade of grass.

original: ji ltar na mi tshangs par spyod pa spong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi tshangs par spyod pa spong ba yin zhe na /
translated: “How do they abandon impure conduct?

original: tshangs pa; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rnams kyi sgo legs par bsrung shing gnas pa yin /
analyzed: tshangs pa; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dbang po rnams kyi sgo legs par bsrung shing gnas pa yin /
translated: “Brahmā, here bodhisattvas guard the doors of their senses and remain so.

original: legs par bsdam pa yin /
analyzed: legs par bsdam pa yin /
translated: They are well restrained.

original: mthun pa'i gnas su rgyu ba yin /🔽shin tu bsrung ba'i dran pa dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: mthun pa'i gnas su rgyu ba yin / shin tu bsrung ba'i dran pa dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They move in suitable places.🔽They have the mindfulness of thorough protection.

original: rtag tu bsrung ba'i dran pa dang ldan yin /
analyzed: rtag tu bsrung ba'i dran pa dang ldan yin /
translated: They have the mindfulness of constant protection.

original: de dran pas yi kun tu srung ba yin /
analyzed: de dran pas yi kun tu srung ba yin /
translated: They are protected by mindfulness.

original: lus dang / ngag shin tu bsdams pa yin no //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag shin tu bsdams pa yin no //
translated: They are well restrained in body and speech.

original: mthun pa'i gnas su rgyu la dran pa dang ldan pa yin zhing 'di snyam du'ang sems bskyed do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i gnas su rgyu la dran pa dang ldan pa yin zhing 'di snyam du'ang sems bskyed do //
translated: They have mindfulness when moving in suitable places, and they think as follows:

original: mi zhig gis bye ma zhing mo shin tu bsregs pa lag pa gnyis kyi snyim pas blangs te mig bkang ba ni sla'i /
analyzed: mi zhig gis bye ma zhing mo shin tu bsregs pa lag pa gnyis kyi snyim pas blangs te mig bkang ba ni sla'i /
translated: ‘It is easy for someone to take a handful of sand that has been heated in a fire with both hands and fill their eyes with it.

original: chags pa'i sems kyis yul gyi bzang mo la lta ba ni lta ma yin no //
analyzed: chags pa'i sems kyis yul gyi bzang mo la lta ba ni lta ma yin no //
translated: But it is not easy for someone with a mind of attachment to look at a beautiful woman.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: bdag yul gyi bzang po la bltas pas yun rung por phung @7b zhing bcom la ma rung bar gyur pa'i phyir ro snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag yul gyi bzang po la bltas pas yun rung por phung @7b zhing bcom la ma rung bar gyur pa'i phyir ro snyam mo //
translated: Because I have been destroyed and ruined by looking at the good qualities of my own country.

original: de de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gnas dang / mal cha dang / stan rnams la dran pa legs par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de de ltar lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gnas dang / mal cha dang / stan rnams la dran pa legs par gnas pa yin te /
translated: In this way, he contemplates the body in the body, and he is well-established in mindfulness with regard to food and drink, and to dwelling, bedding, and sitting.

original: de dag la spyod pa na ro myang bar mi byed cing chags pa'i sems med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la spyod pa na ro myang bar mi byed cing chags pa'i sems med pa yin no //
translated: When he uses these things, he does not savor them, and he is without a greedy mind.

original: gal te de yongs su spyod pa na bde ba skye ba lta na des de la 'di ltar nye bar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de yongs su spyod pa na bde ba skye ba lta na des de la 'di ltar nye bar brtag par bya ste /
translated: If, when he uses them, he feels pleasure, he should investigate that as follows:

original: bde bar snang ba 'di ni bzlog pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: bde bar snang ba 'di ni bzlog pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: “This appearance of pleasure is suffering in the form of a reversal.

original: khams gsum pa 'di na 'dus byas kyi dngos po bde ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: khams gsum pa 'di na 'dus byas kyi dngos po bde ba gang yang med do //
translated: There is no conditioned thing in the three realms that is truly pleasurable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'dus byas mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because conditioned things are impermanent.

original: mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can dag dngos po mi rtag pa rnams la bde ba'i 'du shes ji ltar skyed snyam du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can dag dngos po mi rtag pa rnams la bde ba'i 'du shes ji ltar skyed snyam du brtag par bya'o //
translated: How could the wise and learned conceive of the impermanent as happiness?

original: tshangs pa / gal te byang chub sems dpa' yongs su spyod pa na sdug bsngal kho na skye ba'i bde ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa / gal te byang chub sems dpa' yongs su spyod pa na sdug bsngal kho na skye ba'i bde ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Brahmā, when a bodhisattva is practicing, it is not that happiness arises only from suffering.

original: sdug bsngal des kyang yongs su gnod cing nyon mongs na des de la sems 'di ltar nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal des kyang yongs su gnod cing nyon mongs na des de la sems 'di ltar nye bar gzhag par bya ste /
translated: If he is harmed and afflicted by that suffering, he should settle his mind in this way:

original: lus 'di ni bsgrims te yongs su bskyang dgos pa /
analyzed: lus 'di ni bsgrims te yongs su bskyang dgos pa /
translated: ‘This body must be sustained with effort.

original: gsug gis bsgrub dgos pa ste /
analyzed: gsug gis bsgrub dgos pa ste /
translated: It must be accomplished with care.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal rtsom pas gzung bar mi nus kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal rtsom pas gzung bar mi nus kyi /
translated: It cannot be sustained by creating suffering.

original: bde ba rtsom pas gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bde ba rtsom pas gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It must be sustained by creating happiness.

original: bdag gi lus brtan zhing 'tsho ba'i 'dis dge ba'i chos rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi lus brtan zhing 'tsho ba'i 'dis dge ba'i chos rnams bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: With this body of mine, which is stable and alive, I will accomplish virtuous qualities.’

original: dper na / rnyed pa 'dod pa'i tshong pa khur khal rnams stong bran byed /
analyzed: dper na / rnyed pa 'dod pa'i tshong pa khur khal rnams stong bran byed /
translated: For example, a merchant who desires profit carries an empty load.

original: bcos @8a *// legs byed pa ni khur khal rnams brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: bcos @8a *// legs byed pa ni khur khal rnams brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: “The purpose of mending is not to make the load beautiful,

original: bde bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bde bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: nor is it to make it comfortable.🔽Rather, it is so that the load can be carried as far as it needs to be carried.

original: gzhan du na ji tsam du khal bkal ba bskur ba'i phyir ro; ;de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' kha zas za ba'ang lus brgyan pa'i phyir zas za ba ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan du na ji tsam du khal bkal ba bskur ba'i phyir ro; ;de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' kha zas za ba'ang lus brgyan pa'i phyir zas za ba ma yin /
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva should not eat food in order to make the body beautiful,

original: lus bde ba bya ba'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: lus bde ba bya ba'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: nor in order to make the body comfortable.

original: gzhan du na ji tsam lus dang 'brel pa'i dge ba'i phyogs bsgral ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na ji tsam lus dang 'brel pa'i dge ba'i phyogs bsgral ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems nye bar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Rather, he should think, ‘I will eat food so that the wholesome factors connected with the body can be carried as far as they need to be carried.’

original: tshangs pa / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i gnyen pos sems shes par byed mi nus na /
analyzed: tshangs pa / gal te byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i gnyen pos sems shes par byed mi nus na /
translated: Brahmā, if a bodhisattva is unable to understand the mind by means of the antidotes taught by the Tathāgata,

original: des 'di snyam du bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: des 'di snyam du bsam par bya ste /
translated: he should think as follows:

original: sems zhes bya ba 'dis ni mthar phyin par dka' ba /

analyzed: de gnyis ka'ang gsog nyid dang / gso ba nyid du mthong zhing /

analyzed: bems po nyid dang / snying po med pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: He sees them as inert, as having no core, and as empty.

translated: Seeing thus, he is not attached to the internal elements, and he is not attached to the external elements.

analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs rnams la'ang yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis tshul gcig tu so sor rtog go /

translated: He also discerns with right wisdom the single principle in the ear consciousness and in sounds, in the nose consciousness and in smells, in the tongue consciousness and in tastes, and in the body consciousness and in touchables.🔽He knows the earth element as solidity, and also as liquidity, heat, and motion.

original: chu'i khams la gsher ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes la sra ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid dang / khong stong nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: chu'i khams la gsher ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes la sra ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid dang / khong stong nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the water element as liquidity, and also as solidity, heat, and motion.

original: me'i khams la tsha ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes la sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / khong stong nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: me'i khams la tsha ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes la sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / khong stong nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the fire element as heat, and also as solidity, fluidity, and motility.

original: rlung gi khams la g-yo ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes la yang zhing g-yo ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rlung gi khams la g-yo ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes la yang zhing g-yo ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the wind element as movement, and also as lightness and agitation.

original: de nam mkha'i khams la khong stong du'ang rab tu shes la thams cad du song ba nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //🔽rnam par shes pa'i khams la sgyu ma lta bu nyid du'ang rab tu shes la phyin ci log nyid du'ang rab tu shes /

translated: He knows the space element as cavities, and also as all-pervading.

original: phyin ci ma log pa nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //🔽de mig @12a *//
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa nyid du'ang rab tu shes so // de mig @12a *//
translated: He knows the consciousness element as illusory, and also as mistaken, and also as unmistaken.

analyzed: gi rnam par shes pa la stong pa nyid dang / gzugs la mi rtag pa nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the eye as empty, and also as impermanent with regard to form.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la stong pa nyid dang / sgra la mi rtag pa nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa la stong pa nyid dang / dri la mi rtag pa nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa la stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la stong pa nyid dang / sgra la mi rtag pa nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa la stong pa nyid dang / dri la mi rtag pa nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa la stong pa nyid dang /
translated: He knows that the ear consciousness is emptiness and that sound is impermanent.🔽He knows that the nose consciousness is emptiness and that smell is impermanent.🔽He knows that the tongue consciousness is emptiness and that taste is impermanent.

original: ro la mi rtag pa nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa la stong pa nyid dang / reg bya la mi rtag pa nyid du'ang rab tu shes so //🔽de de ltar shes rab la mkhas pas shin tu rtogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan zhing shes rab rno ba dang ldan te /

translated: He knows that the body consciousness is emptiness and that touch is impermanent.

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyang rab tu shes /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyang rab tu shes /
translated: “In that way, through his skill in insight, he has the insight of complete realization and the sharp insight of knowing that nonvirtuous phenomena are nonvirtuous phenomena,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyang rab tu shes /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyang rab tu shes /
translated: that virtuous phenomena are virtuous phenomena,

original: nyan thos yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyang rab tu shes /
analyzed: nyan thos yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyang rab tu shes /
translated: and that the phenomena that cause the attainment of the śrāvakas are the phenomena that cause the attainment of the śrāvakas.

original: rang sangs rgyas yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the qualities that lead to the attainment of the state of a pratyekabuddha, the qualities that lead to the attainment of the state of a bodhisattva, and the qualities that lead to the attainment of buddhahood.

original: de mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par smin pa chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dvags rnams su skye ba'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par smin pa chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dvags rnams su skye ba'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the small, middling, and great fruitions of nonvirtuous qualities that lead to rebirth as a hell being, an animal, or a hungry ghost.

original: der skyes pa rnams kyi tshor ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'ang @12b rab tu shes so //
analyzed: der skyes pa rnams kyi tshor ba chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'ang @12b rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the small, middling, and great feelings of those who are born there.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po lha rnams kyi nang du'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par smin pa chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po lha rnams kyi nang du'am /
translated: He knows the small, middling, and great fruitions of virtuous qualities that lead to rebirth among the gods

original: mi rnams kyi nang du smin pa'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du smin pa'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: and humans.

analyzed: der skyes pa rnams kyi 'bras bu chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'ang rab tu shes so // nyan thos yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba dang /
translated: He also knows the small, medium, and great fruits of those who are born there.🔽He also knows the aspects of the realization of the fruit of stream-entry, the realization of the fruit of once-returning, the realization of the fruit of non-returning,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rnam pa'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i rnam pa'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: and the realization of the fruit of arhatship, which are the qualities that lead to the accomplishment of a śrāvaka.

original: shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba nyid dang / gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rnam par grol ba nyid dang / gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows the liberation through wisdom and the liberation of both aspects.

original: rang sangs rgyas yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par 'grub pa'ang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyis yang dag par 'grub pa'ang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows the accomplishment of the qualities that lead to the accomplishment of a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'bras bu dang / zhi ba nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / zhi ba nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows the fruit and the state of peace.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs kyi lam yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs kyi lam yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows the path of accumulation of the qualities that bring about the accomplishment of the bodhisattva.

original: ye shes kyi lam yang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi lam yang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows the path of wisdom.

original: shes nas kyang tshogs kyi lam dang / ye shes kyi lam la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: shes nas kyang tshogs kyi lam dang / ye shes kyi lam la brtson par byed do //
translated: Having known, he exerts himself in the path of accumulation and the path of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul che ba nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par 'grub par byed pa'i chos rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul che ba nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: He also knows the greatness of the qualities that bring about the accomplishment of buddhahood.

original: mthu che ba nyid dang / dam pa nyid dang / rab mchog nyid dang / phul du byung ba nyid dang / che @13a *//
analyzed: mthu che ba nyid dang / dam pa nyid dang / rab mchog nyid dang / phul du byung ba nyid dang / che @13a *//
translated: He also knows the supremacy, the excellence, the preeminence, the superiority, the greatness, and the non-commonality of the qualities that bring about the accomplishment of buddhahood.

original: ba nyid dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / thun mong pa'ang ma yin na /
analyzed: ba nyid dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / thun mong pa'ang ma yin na /
translated: If it is not common even to all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas,

original: gzhan sems can thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'i thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: gzhan sems can thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos pa'i thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: what need is there to speak of other sentient beings?

original: de de ltar chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa legs par nye bar gnas pa sdig pa'i chos thams cad dang ni bral /
analyzed: de de ltar chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing dran pa legs par nye bar gnas pa sdig pa'i chos thams cad dang ni bral /
translated: In this way, they observe phenomena in accordance with the Dharma and maintain mindfulness well. They are free from all unwholesome qualities

original: dge ba'i chos ni yang dag par thob /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni yang dag par thob /
translated: and have attained wholesome qualities.

original: lus kyi gnod pa ni med /🔽rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa ni med /
analyzed: lus kyi gnod pa ni med / rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa ni med /
translated: They have no physical harm,🔽no mental harm,

original: sems kyis 'phags pa ni med la chos rnams kyi rgyu'i tshogs dang / 'bras bu yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas /🔽dper na / rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel te; ji ltar rgya mtsho'i rlabs 'bri zhing yang 'byung ba ltar /
analyzed: sems kyis 'phags pa ni med la chos rnams kyi rgyu'i tshogs dang / 'bras bu yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas / dper na / rgya mtsho'i rlabs bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel te; ji ltar rgya mtsho'i rlabs 'bri zhing yang 'byung ba ltar /
translated: and no harm from consciousness. They know the causes and effects of phenomena exactly as they are.🔽Just as the ocean’s waves increase due to wholesome qualities,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos rnams las de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos rnams las de lta ma yin no //
translated: the bodhisattvas do not decrease in wholesome qualities like the ocean’s waves.

original: de dper na /
analyzed: de dper na /
translated: For example,

original: zla ba yar gyi ngo'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra bar dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mngon par 'phel te /
analyzed: zla ba yar gyi ngo'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang 'dra bar dge ba'i chos rnams kyis mngon par 'phel te /

analyzed: ji ltar mar gyi ngo la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor 'bri ba'i chos can yin pa ltar /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos rnams las de lta ma yin no //
translated: but not so for the bodhisattva with regard to phenomena.

translated: Just as in the rainy season, the water in the mountain springs increases, and the water in the springs is the basis for increasing in the rainy season,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chos rnams las de lta ma yin no //
translated: but not so for the bodhisattva with regard to phenomena.

translated: Brahmā, the bodhisattva who trains like this will quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One spoke these verses:

original: lus kyi skyon rnams rab shes na //
analyzed: lus kyi skyon rnams rab shes na //
translated: Having fully understood the faults of the body,

original: lus yod skyon rnams mi ston to //
analyzed: lus yod skyon rnams mi ston to //
translated: one does not display the faults of the body.

original: lus la dran pa legs gnas na //
analyzed: lus la dran pa legs gnas na //
translated: When mindfulness is well-established in the body,

analyzed: skyon med zhi ba'i gnas 'thob bo // lus kyi skyon rnams mi shes na //

analyzed: lus la yod pa'i skyon mi rtogs //
